item.title: La historia de un secuestro masivo
item.description: Unos hombres armados irrumpieron en una escuela católica en Nigeria y raptaron a 253 niños. Sus padres hablan sobre la aterradora experiencia y la falta de interés de las autoridades locales.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Maclean, Ismail Auwal and Taibat Ajiboye

media:content.media:credit: Taibat Ajiboye for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Stephen Samuel.

item.title: Word of the Day: indefatigable
item.description: This word has appeared in 111 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: A Reddit Post Led to a Breakthrough in the Brown Shooting Investigation
item.description: A Reddit user provided information that helped identify Claudio Manuel Neves Valente as not only the suspect in the campus shooting, but also the murder of an M.I.T. professor.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn and Qasim Nauman

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A vehicle is loaded onto a tow truck outside the storage facility in Salem, N.H., where the Brown University shooting suspect’s body was found on Thursday.

item.title: What We Know About the Suspect in the Brown and M.I.T. Killings
item.description: Officials identified a man from Portugal as the suspect in the deadly shooting at Brown University and the killing of an M.I.T. professor. The police said on Thursday he died from a self-inflicted gunshot.
item.dc:creator: Pooja Salhotra

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Law enforcement officers outside a storage facility on Hampshire Road in Salem, N.H., on Thursday night.

item.title: ¿Quién puede resolver los problemas de Irán? Yo no, dice el presidente
item.description: Masoud Pezeshkian, el mandatario iraní, ha dicho que el país enfrenta retos insuperables como una inflación desorbitada y que se ha quedado sin ideas.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi and Leily Nikounazar

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El presidente iraní Masoud Pezeshkian asistió a una protesta en Teherán en junio, tras los ataques estadounidenses contra instalaciones nucleares en Irán.

item.title: How Did a City of 10 Million People Nearly Run Out of Water?
item.description: Restricting Tehran’s growth and water use — however politically difficult — would be more prudent than trying to engineer ever more elaborate workarounds.
item.dc:creator: Peter Frankopan

item.title: Australia Announces Plan to Buy Back Guns in Wake of Bondi Attack
item.description: The program is expected to take hundreds of thousands of firearms out of circulation, the prime minister said on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang and Damien Cave
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, right, at a news conference in Canberra, Australia, on Friday. He announced a nationwide gun buyback plan on the heels of a deadly mass shooting in Sydney last weekend.

item.title: Trump Administration to Appeal Harvard Funding Case
item.description: Facing a deadline to appeal, the Justice Department told the courts late Thursday that it would try to overturn a judge’s ruling in favor of Harvard.
item.dc:creator: Alan Blinder

media:content.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Mass.

item.title: Britain Is Preparing for Attacks on Its Soil. Critics Say It Must Move Faster.
item.description: As military officials sound the alarm over Russian hybrid attacks, the chair of Parliament’s defense committee said the government’s progress on ramping up home defense was “glacial.”
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Dearden

media:content.media:description: British soldiers during an exercise in Smardan, Romania, in February. In June, the British government published a strategic defense review that said the country must move to “war-fighting readiness.”

item.title: Sparks Flew in Their ‘Rave Crew’ Group Chat
item.description: Prakhar Gupta, a podcaster from India, was intrigued when Claudia Robles-Gil, an artist from Mexico City, joined his friend group.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: Corrections: Dec. 19, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Dec. 19, 2025.

item.title: Learning About Her Culture Until it Was No Longer Greek to Him
item.description: Irene Zahariadis was moments from deleting Hinge when she matched with Kevin Walker. It wasn’t long before he was helping roast a goat.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: She Traded Her Beach Vibes for Chickens and Chestnuts
item.description: Michael Craver and Simone Gaillard knew instantly they wanted to be together. Less certain was whether she’d be interested in his farmhouse.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: ‘A Singularly Turbulent Time’: Deeper Uncertainty in Store for Global Economy
item.description: A reordering of the rules of trade, set on top of transformational change in technology, demographics and climate, is remaking jobs, politics and lives.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Cohen

media:content.media:credit: Linh Pham for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A furniture factory in Vietnam. Chinese exports are surging not just into Europe but even more sharply into Southeast Asia.

item.title: When a Performer Met a Playwright
item.description: Like the characters in “When Harry Met Sally …” a film Grace Aki loves, she and F Haynie had a tepid start, and eventually, a romance.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: The Revenge of the People Pleaser
item.description: After being assaulted, I worked for years to make myself invisible. Ryan saw me anyway.
item.dc:creator: Kimberley Falk

item.title: Quote of the Day: The One Boat Strike Hegseth Isn’t Sharing
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, December 19, 2025.

item.title: Before the Massacre, Bondi Suspects Spent Weeks at a Philippine Hotel
item.description: Workers at the budget hotel in the southern Philippines, a region that has long battled Islamist insurgencies, said the two men rarely left their room.
item.dc:creator: Pranav Baskar
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:description: The suspects in the Bondi Beach mass shooting stayed at the GV Hotel in the Philippine city of Davao for most of November, hotel staff said.

media:content.media:credit: U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of Massachusetts, via Reuters

item.title: Watch Live: Authorities Hold Press Conference
item.description: The authorities in Boston hold a press conference. Earlier, officials in Providence, R.I., announced that the body of a suspect in the Brown University shooting was found in New Hampshire.

media:content.media:credit: U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of Massachusetts, via Reuters

item.title: Bank of Japan Raises Interest Rates to Highest Level in 30 Years
item.description: The Bank of Japan moved to slow inflation as the prime minister is borrowing more to fund an ambitious effort to build up industry and support households.
item.dc:creator: River Akira Davis

media:content.media:description: The rate increase is widely viewed as an attempt to ultimately help cool inflation and give wages a chance to keep up.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 19, 2025
item.description: Hemant Mehta opens our solving weekend.
item.dc:creator: Deb Amlen

media:content.media:description: Hemant Mehta is waiting for you to catch on to his clues.

item.title: Judge Convicted of Obstructing Agents as They Sought Undocumented Immigrant
item.description: The Wisconsin state judge, Hannah C. Dugan, was accused of ushering a man to a side door as federal agents waited outside a courtroom.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman

media:content.media:description: Judge Hannah C. Dugan entered court on the first day of her federal trial.

item.title: NASA Webb Telescope Discovers Lemon-Shaped Planet, the ‘Stretchiest’ Ever Seen
item.description: An unusual object orbiting a rapidly spinning star might be a new phenomenon in the universe.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan O’Callaghan

media:content.media:description: An artist’s impression of the lemon-shaped world, which astronomers say would be red because of dust and soot from the carbon in its atmosphere.

item.title: Several Billion Dollars Were Lost to Fraud in Minnesota, Prosecutors Say
item.description: Federal prosecutors said they were now investigating fraud worth billions of dollars in 14 social services programs in the state.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Federal agents executed a search warrant as part of a fraud investigation in Minnesota.

item.title: New Judges Take Charge of Sept. 11 Case at Guantánamo
item.description: The long-running case had been on hold for nearly a year because of higher court appeals and the retirement of the military judge.
item.dc:creator: Carol Rosenberg
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Lt. Col. Michael Schrama was a student at Georgetown University on Sept. 11, 2001. He is now the fifth judge to preside in the military commission case of defendants in the terrorism attacks.

item.title: La mujer de la ‘kiss cam’ del concierto de Coldplay habla
item.description: Kristin Cabot fue grabada con su jefe en un concierto. El video se hizo viral. Pronto se vio ahogada en el veneno de desconocidos.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Miller

media:content.media:credit: Greta Rybus para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: “Se pueden cometer errores y se puede tocar fondo, pero tampoco te tienen que amenazar de muerte por esos errores”.

item.title: James B. Hunt Jr., North Carolina Governor Who Kept State Blue, Dies at 88
item.description: During his 16 years in office, he earned national acclaim for his focus on education. But losing his bid for the Senate in 1984 cost him a shot at the presidency.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Martin

media:content.media:description: Gov. James B. Hunt Jr. of North Carolina in 1982. He sustained the state’s Democrats as a political force for more than a quarter century, even as he lost a vicious Senate race to Jesse Helms in 1984.

item.title: Democratic State Lawmakers Vow to Unite and Push Back on Trump’s Deportations
item.description: Lawmakers from a half-dozen states said Thursday they will use legislation next year to thwart the tactics of federal law enforcement carrying out immigration policies.
item.dc:creator: David W. Chen

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents and other federal law enforcement officers conducted a street raid in New York in October.

item.title: Trump’s Attacks on Rob Reiner and Others Characterize an Uninhibited 2nd Term
item.description: Many of President Trump’s supporters love his professional-wrestling style of leadership. But some of his recent attacks have sickened even some of his own political allies.
item.dc:creator: Peter Baker

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mr. Trump’s brash personality has been an element of his appeal to supporters, who find it bracingly authentic in contrast to cookie-cutter politicians.

item.title: For the First Time, a Former Refugee Will Lead the U.N.’s Refugee Agency
item.description: Barham Salih, who fought against Saddam Hussein’s rule in Iraq and later served as president, was chosen to lead the U.N. High Commission for Refugees.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi and Nick Cumming-Bruce
item.category: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

media:content.media:description: Barham Salih speaking before the United Nations in 2019, when he was the president of Iraq.

item.title: Trump Relies on Distortions to Support His Pressure Campaign on Venezuela
item.description: The president has a long record of making false or misleading statements. But the sheer density of them in his administration’s boat attacks and Venezuela pressure campaign is exceptional.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

media:content.media:description: Mr. Trump says an “armed conflict” makes the killings of people on the vessels lawful, but law-of-war experts say standards for a war to exist are not met.

item.title: Vegan Cacio e Pepe
item.description: This speedy vegan take on cacio e pepe utilizes a classic technique: Cook the pasta just short of al dente, reserve some of the starchy pasta water to add body to the sauce, then simmer the pasta in its sauce with a splash of pasta water, stirring vigorously until the sauce is emulsified.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times Cooking

item.title: TikTok Signs Agreements With Investors in Step Toward Avoiding a U.S. Ban
item.description: The Chinese-owned video app formalized commitments from the software giant Oracle and two investment firms as part of a deal to keep operating in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Emmett Lindner

media:content.media:description: Investment agreements bring TikTok, one of the country’s most popular social media apps, closer to resolving years of questions about its future.

item.title: The U.S. Moves to End Gender-Related Care for Minors
item.description: Also, authorities search for a person of interest in the Brown shooting. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

item.title: President Trump Reclassifies Marijuana With Executive Order
item.description: Marijuana was downgraded from a Schedule I drug to a Schedule III drug on Thursday. The reclassification does not legalize cannabis, but it does ease restrictions on the substance and allows for more research.

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump said the move would allow for more research to be done with cannabis.

item.title: Nike’s Struggles Continue, but Turnaround Plan May Be Working
item.description: Quarterly sales rose slightly for the world’s largest footwear company despite weak results in China and with its Converse brand.
item.dc:creator: Kim Bhasin

media:content.media:description: Nike is among the retailers affected by tariffs this year.

item.title: Coming Soon to a TV Near Trump: A G.O.P. Ad in N.Y. Governor’s Race
item.description: Bruce Blakeman, an ally of President Trump, is buying ad time on Fox News in the West Palm Beach, Fla., market, where Mr. Trump may be watching.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Fandos

media:content.media:description: Bruce Blakeman, left, is one of two allies of President Trump running for governor of New York.

item.title: California Storms and Snow in the Northeast: Christmas Travel Forecast
item.description: If you’re planning to hit the road in the next few days, here’s where storms may snarl your plans.
item.dc:creator: Judson Jones

item.title: Jelly Roll Is Pardoned for Previous Robbery and Drug Convictions
item.description: The clemency decision by Gov. Bill Lee of Tennessee could make it easier for the country star to travel internationally.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan

media:content.media:description: Jelly Roll was found guilty of participating in an armed robbery in 2002. In another case, the police found cocaine and marijuana in his car.

item.title: 7 Killed in North Carolina Jet Crash
item.description: Five adults and two people were killed after a small passenger jet crashed at the Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina, according to the local sheriff. The plane was registered to the NASCAR driver Greg Biffle.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal
item.category: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing

item.title: Trump Mocks Obama, Biden in His Presidential ‘Walk of Fame’
item.description: The White House unveiled new plaques near the Oval Office mocking some of President Trump’s predecessors. The new display distorts history and aligns with Mr. Trump’s worldview.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Jackeline Luna

media:content.media:description: The presidential walk of fame, the latest addition to the White House, seen at the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Sue Bender, Who Wrote About Living With the Amish, Dies at 91
item.description: “Plain and Simple,” her best-selling 1989 book, was a go-to text of the anti-materialist movement known as voluntary simplicity.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel

item.title: Christian Turner Is Appointed New UK Ambassador to US
item.description: Christian Turner’s appointment comes as the United States and Britain’s relationship is being tested amid a number of foreign policy issues.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Castle

media:content.media:description: Christian Turner, right, will become the next British ambassador to the United States after his predecessor was dismissed over his links to the financier Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: A Cozy Christmas Brunch Menu
item.description: Turn Genevieve Ko’s cinnamon roll Bundt cake, breakfast enchiladas or sesame scallion buns into a new holiday tradition.
item.dc:creator: Genevieve Ko

media:content.media:credit: David Malosh for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Rebecca Jurkevich.
media:content.media:description: Clockwise from top left, Genevieve Ko’s cinnamon roll Bundt cake, breakfast enchiladas and sesame scallion buns.

item.title: U.S. Accuses Venezuelan of Masterminding Tren de Aragua’s Expansion
item.description: The gang, which was the subject of charges brought in several states, is President Trump’s chosen nemesis. The defendant remains at large.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Weiser and Alan Feuer

media:content.media:credit: Secretaria De Prensa De La Presidencia, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: A U.S. Air Force airplane carried deportees accused of being members of Tren de Aragua to El Salvador in March.
